title: Emperor Tenji of Japan introduces a water clock (clepsydra) called Rokoku. The instrument, which measures time and indicates hours, is placed in the capital of Ōtsu.
text: Emperor Tenji of Japan introduces a water clock (clepsydra) called Rokoku. The instrument, which measures time and indicates hours, is placed in the capital of Ōtsu.

title: Third Crusade: Frederick I Barbarossa drowns in the river Saleph while leading an army to Jerusalem.
text: Third Crusade: Frederick I Barbarossa drowns in the river Saleph while leading an army to Jerusalem.

title: The Battle of Pelekanon results in a Byzantine defeat by the Ottoman Empire.
text: The Battle of Pelekanon results in a Byzantine defeat by the Ottoman Empire.

title: Copenhagen is surrounded by the army of Frederick I of Denmark, as the city won't recognise him as the successor of Christian II of Denmark.
text: Copenhagen is surrounded by the army of Frederick I of Denmark, as the city won't recognise him as the successor of Christian II of Denmark.

title: Council of Trent: Pope Paul III sends out letters to his bishops, delaying the Council due to war and the difficulty bishops had traveling to Venice.
text: Council of Trent: Pope Paul III sends out letters to his bishops, delaying the Council due to war and the difficulty bishops had traveling to Venice.

title: Willem Barents and Jacob van Heemskerk discover Bear Island.
text: Willem Barents and Jacob van Heemskerk discover Bear Island.

title: Thirty Years' War: Battle of Záblatí, a turning point in the Bohemian Revolt.
text: Thirty Years' War: Battle of Záblatí, a turning point in the Bohemian Revolt.

title: Signing of the Treaty of Compiègne between France and the Netherlands.
text: Signing of the Treaty of Compiègne between France and the Netherlands.

title: Salem witch trials: Bridget Bishop is hanged at Gallows Hill near Salem, Massachusetts, for "certaine Detestable Arts called Witchcraft & Sorceries".
text: Salem witch trials: Bridget Bishop is hanged at Gallows Hill near Salem, Massachusetts, for "certaine Detestable Arts called Witchcraft & Sorceries".

title: Jacobite risings: Battle of Glen Shiel.
text: Jacobite risings: Battle of Glen Shiel.

title: King Buddha Yodfa Chulaloke (Rama I) of Siam (modern day Thailand) is crowned.
text: King Buddha Yodfa Chulaloke (Rama I) of Siam (modern day Thailand) is crowned.

title: A landslide dam on the Dadu River created by an earthquake ten days earlier collapses, killing 100,000 in the Sichuan province of China.
text: A landslide dam on the Dadu River created by an earthquake ten days earlier collapses, killing 100,000 in the Sichuan province of China.

title: The Jardin des Plantes museum opens in Paris. A year later, it becomes the first public zoo.
text: The Jardin des Plantes museum opens in Paris. A year later, it becomes the first public zoo.

title: French Revolution: Following the arrests of Girondin leaders, the Jacobins gain control of the Committee of Public Safety installing the revolutionary dictatorship.
text: French Revolution: Following the arrests of Girondin leaders, the Jacobins gain control of the Committee of Public Safety installing the revolutionary dictatorship.

title: First Barbary War: Yusuf Karamanli signs a treaty ending the hostilities between Tripolitania and the United States.
text: First Barbary War: Yusuf Karamanli signs a treaty ending the hostilities between Tripolitania and the United States.

title: The first Boat Race between the University of Oxford and the University of Cambridge takes place on the Thames in London.
text: The first Boat Race between the University of Oxford and the University of Cambridge takes place on the Thames in London.

title: Myall Creek massacre: Twenty-eight Aboriginal Australians are murdered.
text: Myall Creek massacre: Twenty-eight Aboriginal Australians are murdered.

title: The United States Naval Academy graduates its first class of students.
text: The United States Naval Academy graduates its first class of students.

title: American Civil War: Battle of Big Bethel: Confederate troops under John B. Magruder defeat a much larger Union force led by General Ebenezer W. Pierce in Virginia.
text: American Civil War: Battle of Big Bethel: Confederate troops under John B. Magruder defeat a much larger Union force led by General Ebenezer W. Pierce in Virginia.

title: American Civil War: Battle of Brice's Crossroads: Confederate troops under Nathan Bedford Forrest defeat a much larger Union force led by General Samuel D. Sturgis in Mississippi.
text: American Civil War: Battle of Brice's Crossroads: Confederate troops under Nathan Bedford Forrest defeat a much larger Union force led by General Samuel D. Sturgis in Mississippi.

title: Mihailo Obrenović III, Prince of Serbia is assassinated.
text: Mihailo Obrenović III, Prince of Serbia is assassinated.

title: Sinmiyangyo: Captain McLane Tilton leads 109 US Marines in a naval attack on Han River forts on Kanghwa Island, Korea.
text: Sinmiyangyo: Captain McLane Tilton leads 109 US Marines in a naval attack on Han River forts on Kanghwa Island, Korea.

title: League of Prizren is established, to oppose the decisions of the Congress of Berlin and the Treaty of San Stefano, as a consequence of which the Albanian lands in the Balkans were being partitioned and given to the neighbor states of Serbia, Montenegro, Bulgaria, and Greece.
text: League of Prizren is established, to oppose the decisions of the Congress of Berlin and the Treaty of San Stefano, as a consequence of which the Albanian lands in the Balkans were being partitioned and given to the neighbor states of Serbia, Montenegro, Bulgaria, and Greece.

title: Mount Tarawera in New Zealand erupts, killing 153 people and burying the famous Pink and White Terraces. Eruptions continue for three months creating a large, 17 km long fissure across the mountain peak.
text: Mount Tarawera in New Zealand erupts, killing 153 people and burying the famous Pink and White Terraces. Eruptions continue for three months creating a large, 17 km long fissure across the mountain peak.

title: Spanish–American War: U.S. Marines land on the island of Cuba.
text: Spanish–American War: U.S. Marines land on the island of Cuba.

title: The Arab Revolt against the Ottoman Empire was declared by Hussein bin Ali, Sharif of Mecca.
text: The Arab Revolt against the Ottoman Empire was declared by Hussein bin Ali, Sharif of Mecca.

title: The Austro-Hungarian battleship SMS Szent István sinks off the Croatian coast after being torpedoed by an Italian MAS motorboat; the event is recorded by camera from a nearby vessel.
text: The Austro-Hungarian battleship SMS Szent István sinks off the Croatian coast after being torpedoed by an Italian MAS motorboat; the event is recorded by camera from a nearby vessel.

title: Fascists kidnap and kill Italian Socialist leader Giacomo Matteotti in Rome.
text: Fascists kidnap and kill Italian Socialist leader Giacomo Matteotti in Rome.

title: Dr. Robert Smith takes his last drink, and Alcoholics Anonymous is founded in Akron, Ohio, United States, by him and Bill Wilson.
text: Dr. Robert Smith takes his last drink, and Alcoholics Anonymous is founded in Akron, Ohio, United States, by him and Bill Wilson.

title: Chaco War ends: A truce is called between Bolivia and Paraguay who had been fighting since 1932.
text: Chaco War ends: A truce is called between Bolivia and Paraguay who had been fighting since 1932.

title: World War II: The Kingdom of Italy declares war on France and the United Kingdom.
text: World War II: The Kingdom of Italy declares war on France and the United Kingdom.

title: World War II: U.S. President Franklin D. Roosevelt denounces Italy's actions in his "Stab in the Back" speech at the graduation ceremonies of the University of Virginia.
text: World War II: U.S. President Franklin D. Roosevelt denounces Italy's actions in his "Stab in the Back" speech at the graduation ceremonies of the University of Virginia.

title: World War II: Military resistance to the German occupation of Norway ends.
text: World War II: Military resistance to the German occupation of Norway ends.

title: World War II: Nazis burn the Czech village of Lidice in reprisal for the killing of Reinhard Heydrich.
text: World War II: Nazis burn the Czech village of Lidice in reprisal for the killing of Reinhard Heydrich.

title: World War II: Six hundred forty-two men, women and children massacred at Oradour-sur-Glane, France.
text: World War II: Six hundred forty-two men, women and children massacred at Oradour-sur-Glane, France.

title: World War II: In Distomo, Boeotia, Greece, 218 men, women and children are massacred by German troops.
text: World War II: In Distomo, Boeotia, Greece, 218 men, women and children are massacred by German troops.

title: In baseball, 15-year-old Joe Nuxhall of the Cincinnati Reds becomes the youngest player ever in a major-league game.
text: In baseball, 15-year-old Joe Nuxhall of the Cincinnati Reds becomes the youngest player ever in a major-league game.

title: Australian Imperial Forces land in Brunei Bay to liberate Brunei.
text: Australian Imperial Forces land in Brunei Bay to liberate Brunei.

title: Saab produces its first automobile.
text: Saab produces its first automobile.

title: John Diefenbaker leads the Progressive Conservative Party of Canada to a stunning upset in the Canadian federal election, 1957, ending 22 years of Liberal Party government.
text: John Diefenbaker leads the Progressive Conservative Party of Canada to a stunning upset in the Canadian federal election, 1957, ending 22 years of Liberal Party government.

title: The Equal Pay Act of 1963, aimed at abolishing wage disparity based on sex, was signed into law by John F. Kennedy as part of his New Frontier Program.
text: The Equal Pay Act of 1963, aimed at abolishing wage disparity based on sex, was signed into law by John F. Kennedy as part of his New Frontier Program.

title: United States Senate breaks a 75-day filibuster against the Civil Rights Act of 1964, leading to the bill's passage.
text: United States Senate breaks a 75-day filibuster against the Civil Rights Act of 1964, leading to the bill's passage.

title: The Six-Day War ends: Israel and Syria agree to a cease-fire.
text: The Six-Day War ends: Israel and Syria agree to a cease-fire.

title: James Earl Ray escapes from Brushy Mountain State Prison in Petros, Tennessee. He is recaptured three days later.
text: James Earl Ray escapes from Brushy Mountain State Prison in Petros, Tennessee. He is recaptured three days later.

title: The African National Congress in South Africa publishes a call to fight from their imprisoned leader Nelson Mandela.
text: The African National Congress in South Africa publishes a call to fight from their imprisoned leader Nelson Mandela.

title: The Syrian Arab Army led by generals Ali and Habib Mahmood defeat the Israeli Defense Forces near Sultan Yacoub, Lebanon, during the 1982 Lebanon War resulting in 30 dead and 3 missing for the IDF, 10 tanks lost and 3 APCs destroyed
text: The Syrian Arab Army led by generals Ali and Habib Mahmood defeat the Israeli Defense Forces near Sultan Yacoub, Lebanon, during the 1982 Lebanon War resulting in 30 dead and 3 missing for the IDF, 10 tanks lost and 3 APCs destroyed

title: British Airways Flight 5390 lands safely at Southampton Airport after a blowout in the cockpit causes the captain to be partially sucked from the cockpit. There are no fatalities
text: British Airways Flight 5390 lands safely at Southampton Airport after a blowout in the cockpit causes the captain to be partially sucked from the cockpit. There are no fatalities

title: Eleven-year-old Jaycee Lee Dugard is kidnapped in South Lake Tahoe, California; she would remain a captive until 2009.
text: Eleven-year-old Jaycee Lee Dugard is kidnapped in South Lake Tahoe, California; she would remain a captive until 2009.

title: China conducts a nuclear test for DF-31 warhead at Area C (Beishan), Lop Nur, its prominence being due to the Cox Report.
text: China conducts a nuclear test for DF-31 warhead at Area C (Beishan), Lop Nur, its prominence being due to the Cox Report.

title: Peace talks begin in Northern Ireland without the participation of Sinn Féin.
text: Peace talks begin in Northern Ireland without the participation of Sinn Féin.

title: Before fleeing his northern stronghold, Khmer Rouge leader Pol Pot orders the killing of his defense chief Son Sen and 11 of Sen's family members.

title: Kosovo War: NATO suspends its airstrikes after Slobodan Milošević agrees to withdraw Serbian forces from Kosovo.

title: Pope John Paul II canonizes Lebanon's first female saint, Saint Rafqa.

title: The first direct electronic communication experiment between the nervous systems of two humans is carried out by Kevin Warwick in the United Kingdom.
